intro: Crossopetalum ekmanii, commonly known as the Ecuadorian bellflower, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of Ecuador. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude regions, often in rocky or moist forest habitats. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
